@puplone 

Regarding movie resolution sizes, this can vary.  Movies are not always transferred to consumer video format at the esact same aspect ratio as projected in a cinema, so there is not real exact standard other than the limits imposed by different codecs for alignment to pixel multipliers (8 or 16 usually).  Toy Stor 3 for example on Blu-Ray does not fill the complete 1920x1080 HD resolution, it's just short of 1920 because the source frame from Pixar's render is also short of 1920.  it's accurate however, because it is 1:1 pixel match with the original Pixar rendered frame.

Definition of: TROLLING

(2) Posting derogatory messages about sensitive subjects on newsgroups and chat rooms to bait users into responding.

and from http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Troll_(Internet)
"Do Not Feed The Trolls" and its abbreviation "DNFTT" 
In Internet slang, a TROLL is someone who posts inflammatory, extraneous, or off-topic messages in an online community...with the primary intent of provoking readers into an emotional response or of otherwise disrupting normal on-topic discussion.
